intro: Tithymalus schimperianus, commonly known as the Schimper's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
